Database

Class DBcontroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • Database.DBcontroller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DBcontrollerInterface

    public class DBcontroller
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBcontrollerInterface
    Implementation of the DB interface for the DB view.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Daniel Menahem 39676804, Michael Shvarts 301578878
    See Also:
    JavaDoc made under the assumption that the HTML generated doc will include private fields. Under different circumstances, the private attributes would be documented in the public getters, and the rest would link there. Private attributes documentation was made so everything will be documented.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBcontroller()
      A public constructor to connect to DB and create the database table.

    • Method Detail

      • insertEvent

        public void insertEvent(java.lang.String playerID,
                        int gameID,
                        int gameScore,
                        GameObjects.EventType event)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DBcontrollerInterface
        Insert an event to the DB.
        Specified by:
        insertEvent in interface DBcontrollerInterface
        Parameters:
        playerID - player's name, string inserted by the user
        gameID - game's ID. To insert, get current number of games and increment it by 1 to avoid collisions
        gameScore - game's score at the moment of the event
        event - event type EventType
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions

        Get current number of games.

      • getAllGamesByMostEventsDescending

        public java.util.ArrayList<Record> getAllGamesByMostEventsDescending(GameObjects.EventType event)
                                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        Description copied from interface: DBcontrollerInterface
        Get all the games, sorted by number of events of a certain type, descending.
        Specified by:
        getAllGamesByMostEventsDescending in interface DBcontrollerInterface
        Parameters:
        event - type of event to count, (EventType END_GAME is not relevant for this query (1 per game))
        Returns:
        ArrayList of Record selected in the DB
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - DB SQL exceptions
